web-app.description:
This file defines the Voyager WebVoyage application.
The database must be configured in the Context for this web application, although references to it are defined below.
Change xxxdb to the actual name of the database.
Change the value of Config to the actual full path.

context-param.description: The root location of the XSL templates and properties files in this application.
The root location of the ini and properties files in this application.
The host of the voyager XServices.
The port at which voyager XServices can be found
The amount of time in seconds to wait for VXWS to respond.
The amount of time in seconds to wait before retrying to connect to VXWS
The name of the properties file that defines messages for web service return codes.
The name of the properties file that defines messages for web service return codes.
The base URL to reach WebVoyage online help. The param-value must end with a slash (/). The string %SKIN%, if it exists, will be replaced with the skin in use at the time a web page is created.

The default help page. If a page servlet has an init-param HelpPage defined, the help links on the page created by that servlet will use that value in creating a URL. If there is no HelpPage, this DefaultHelpPage will be used instead.

Option to enable caching contents of *.properties and *.xsl files. If set to Y, then the the properties and stylesheet files will be read from disk the first time they are needed, and any changes made to the files will not be picked up until tomcat is restarted. Default is not to cache.
Flag to enable or disable PDS Support. (True / False)
The host of the Patron Data Services.
The port at which Patron Data Services can be found
The Institution "tab_service" which to operate under in PDS

init-param.description: The default skin (locale) to use in this application. This value must exactly match (including case) one of the ui subdirectory names.
The CreateURL is where to redirect requests that require a login, so the authentication information may be created in the user's session.

ExternalAuthenticationOnly is an optional parameter, set to "Y" to indicate that the CreateURL param is an external authentication adaptor and that the WebVoyage login screen is to be bypassed. However, if the CreateURL param is the WebVoyage login screen, then this param should be set to "N". Doing so still allows an external authentication adaptor to be accessed from the WebVoyage login screen.

The property file and skin file (see below) are used to check if a user specifies external log in and to bypass the log in screen. If so, try to redirect to the external log in screen instead of internal log in screen.
The skin file directory for the customized property file.

filter.description: This filter ensures that all search services use clients that are connected to each other, so we can maintain a stateful connection all the way to the OPACSVR at the far back end.
This filter performs maintenance operations (add/delete) on an authenticated user's "list" or "bookbag" of saved items. Configure it *after* the authentication filter.
This filter performs removing any existing connection to the database and connecting to the newly user defined database

servlet.display-name: Get Authenticated Scan Doc Action Servlet
